source.0fb6f489:
for lat, lng, in zip(crime2.Latitude, crime2.Longitude):
    incidents.add_child(
        folium.features.Marker(
            [lat, lng],
            radius=5, # define how big you want the circle markers to be
            color='yellow',
            fill=True,
            fill_color='blue',
            fill_opacity=0.6
        )
    )

# add incidents to map
CHIcrime_map.add_child(incidents)

source.fca5e227: Now, let's create a map of the city, then a map including markers of the incidents in the area.
source.4180eef5:
# Objective

To explore and analyze Chicago’s criminal data to better understand the results from the Chicago Police Department to evaluate  their overall effectiveness that could lead to future recommendations .
source.3cba4852:
# Dataset

The dataset explored reflects reported incidents of crime (with the exception of murders where data exists for each victim) that occurred in the City of Chicago for 2019. Specifically from the beginning of the year to the day of analysis. Should you have questions about this dataset, you may contact the Research & Development Division of the Chicago Police Department at 312.745.6071 or RandD@chicagopolice.org. Chicago's crime data for 2019 was pulled from https://data.cityofchicago.org/Public-Safety/Crimes-2019/w98m-zvie.
source.b412c4f5: Lets read in our crime data from the City of Chicago and try to get familiar with the dataset.
